intro: Leucas riukiuensis, commonly known as the Ryukyu leucas, is a flowering plant native to the Ryukyu Islands of Japan. It belongs to the family Lamiaceae, which includes many aromatic herbs and shrubs. The plant is characterized by its slender, upright stems and small, opposite leaves that are typically covered in fine hairs. Its flowers are usually pale blue or violet, arranged in whorled clusters, and bloom during the summer months. Leucas riukiuensis is often found in moist, shaded environments such as forests and rocky slopes.
